column4: I'm confused... gcc is installed on my ubuntu setup... (desktop, 6.10) but I can't seem to /compile/ anything without it bitterly complaining about underfined fn's and a zillion other things
what else do I need to apt-get in order to have a properly functioning 'C compiler' under ubuntu?
you need 'build-essential' - you also need header files for the libraries you're trying to build with
